channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13925] Use zookeeper multi to clear znodes in ZKProcedureUtil
item.description: Address the TODO in ZKProcedureUtil clearChildZNodes() and clearZNodes methods
item.summary: Use zookeeper multi to clear znodes in ZKProcedureUtil

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Patch for master branch.
Please review.

I am not sure whether this should be treated as a bug/improvement so left the Fix Version/s as it is.
I think we should treat this as an improvement so updated the issue type and fix versions accordingly.

Patch is an improvement over what we have today when zk supports multi()

+1

I went looking for concurrency concerns but racing recursive deletes would be a problem with or without the patch.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12740109/HBASE-13925.patch
against master branch at commit 1b5ad45b8584afce8f8dc0be558844b7401c0caf.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12740109

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 12 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.1 2.5.2 2.6.0)

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 protoc. The applied patch does not increase the total number of protoc compiler warnings.

-1 javadoc. The javadoc tool appears to have generated 1 warning messages.

+1 checkstyle. The applied patch does not increase the total number of checkstyle errors

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.replication.TestReplicationTrackerZKImpl

-1 core zombie tests. There are 5 zombie test(s): at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.TestLoadIncrementalHFiles.testRegionCrossingHFileSplit(TestLoadIncrementalHFiles.java:195)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.TestLoadIncrementalHFiles.testRegionCrossingHFileSplitRowColBloom(TestLoadIncrementalHFiles.java:191)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.TestHFileOutputFormat2.testMRIncrementalLoad(TestHFileOutputFormat2.java:375)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.TestTableInputFormatScanBase.testScan(TestTableInputFormatScanBase.java:244)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.TestTableInputFormatScan1.testScanEmptyToOPP(TestTableInputFormatScan1.java:99)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.TestCopyTable.testCopyTableWithBulkload(TestCopyTable.java:131)

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14443//testReport/
Release Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14443//artifact/patchprocess/newFindbugsWarnings.html
Checkstyle Errors: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14443//artifact/patchprocess/checkstyle-aggregate.html

Javadoc warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14443//artifact/patchprocess/patchJavadocWarnings.txt
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14443//console

This message is automatically generated.

Thanks for the review Andrew.
Test failure is legit, will look into this in some time.

In the first patch I missed to set watches on the deleting nodes. Addressed this in v1 patch.
Please review.
Re-attached same patch again for a QA run.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12740819/HBASE-13925-v1-again.patch
against master branch at commit db08013ebeeaa85802d9795cc72b4c29c5338a47.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12740819

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 12 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.1 2.5.2 2.6.0)

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 protoc. The applied patch does not increase the total number of protoc compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 checkstyle. The applied patch does not increase the total number of checkstyle errors

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

-1 site. The patch appears to cause mvn post-site goal to fail.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.TestImportExport
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.TestProcessBasedCluster

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14483//testReport/
Release Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14483//artifact/patchprocess/newFindbugsWarnings.html
Checkstyle Errors: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14483//artifact/patchprocess/checkstyle-aggregate.html

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14483//console

This message is automatically generated.
Thanks for the updated patch fixing the watcher issue. The latest precommit failures could be from a noisy build, let me apply and run the tests locally. Back in a bit.
All tests pass.

Andrew Purtell, it looks like HBASE-7847 was not committed to 0.98 and 1.3. To apply this patch cleanly to those branches we need to have that and IMO that should be good to commit in 0.98 and 1.3, what you say ? If yes, should I combine that jira and this jira patch code and attach the patch here or open a backport jira for it ?

Ashish Singhi, I think you mean 0.98 and 1.0. I see HBASE-7847 in the commit history of 1.1 and later branches. I don't see a compatibility issue, but ask Enis Soztutar about 1.0. An improvement in Procedure handling can arguably avoid hitting latent bugs someday, but this does fall today in the 'not a bugfix' bucket I suspect.
Andrew, what about 0.98 ? Shall I combine both the jiras into a single patch or should I create a backport jira for it?
I think we can pick back the patch for HBASE-7847 to 0.98 and 1.0 with only minor fuzz and then the patch here would just about apply. Curious what Enis says before proceeding.

I think we can pick back the patch for HBASE-7847 to 0.98 and 1.0 with only minor fuzz and then the patch here would just about apply. Curious what Enis says before proceeding.

It is not immediately clear to me what racing condition this and HBASE-7847 solves. But since we use multi for most of the operations it will not hurt to use it for delete recursive as well.
I'll say we should backport both patches to 0.98 and 1.0 if we can identify a concurrency issue that it addresses. Lacking that, I would be +0.

It is not immediately clear to me what racing condition this and HBASE-7847 solves.

It is not atomic, it can leave us in a inconsistent state.
Ok, I will pick back HBASE-7847 and then commit this back through to 0.98.
Thanks Andrew. Just let me know if I can be any helpful here.
Pushed to 0.98 and up
